get.description: Retrieves all API tokens that match a given token name. Because token names are not unique, this endpoint will always return a list. If no tokens with the provided name exist, the list will be empty. Otherwise, it will contain all the tokens with the given name.

username.description: This property was deprecated in Unleash v5. Prefer the `tokenName` property instead.

tokenName.description: A unique name for this particular token

environment.description: The environment the token has access to. `*` if it has access to all environments.

project.description: The project this token belongs to.

projects.description: The list of projects this token has access to. If the token has access to specific projects they will be listed here. If the token has access to all projects it will be represented as `[*]`

expiresAt.description: The token's expiration date. NULL if the token doesn't have an expiration set.

seenAt.description: When the token was last seen/used to authenticate with. NULL if the token has not yet been used for authentication.

alias.description: Alias is no longer in active use and will often be NULL. It's kept around as a way of allowing old proxy tokens created with the old metadata format to keep working.

tokens.description: A list of Unleash API tokens.

createApiTokenSchema.description: The data required to create an [Unleash API token](https://docs.getunleash.io/reference/api-tokens-and-client-keys).

expiresAt.description: The time when this token should expire.

type.description: An admin token. Must be the string "admin" (not case sensitive).

expiresAt.description: The time when this token should expire.

type.description: An admin token. Must be the string "admin" (not case sensitive).

username.description: The name of the token. This property was deprecated in v5. Use `tokenName` instead.

expiresAt.description: The time when this token should expire.

type.description: A client or frontend token. Must be one of the strings "client" or "frontend" (not case sensitive).

environment.description: The environment that the token should be valid for. Defaults to "default"

project.description: The project that the token should be valid for. Defaults to "*" meaning every project. This property is mutually incompatible with the `projects` property. If you specify one, you cannot specify the other.

projects.description: A list of projects that the token should be valid for. This property is mutually incompatible with the `project` property. If you specify one, you cannot specify the other.

expiresAt.description: The time when this token should expire.

type.description: A client or frontend token. Must be one of the strings "client" or "frontend" (not case sensitive).

environment.description: The environment that the token should be valid for. Defaults to "default"

project.description: The project that the token should be valid for. Defaults to "*" meaning every project. This property is mutually incompatible with the `projects` property. If you specify one, you cannot specify the other.

projects.description: A list of projects that the token should be valid for. This property is mutually incompatible with the `project` property. If you specify one, you cannot specify the other.

username.description: The name of the token. This property was deprecated in v5. Use `tokenName` instead.

createPatSchema.description: Describes the properties required to create a [personal access token](https://docs.getunleash.io/reference/api-tokens-and-client-keys#personal-access-tokens), or PAT. PATs are automatically scoped to the authenticated user.

id.description: The user id

isAPI.description: Deprecated in v5. Used internally to know which operations the user should be allowed to perform

name.description: Name of the user

username.description: A unique username for the user

imageUrl.description: URL used for the user profile image

inviteLink.description: If the user is actively inviting other users, this is the link that can be shared with other users

loginAttempts.description: How many unsuccessful attempts at logging in has the user made

emailSent.description: Is the welcome email sent to the user or not

rootRole.description: Which [root role](https://docs.getunleash.io/reference/rbac#predefined-roles) this user is assigned. Usually a numeric role ID, but can be a string when returning newly created user with an explicit string role.

seenAt.description: The last time this user logged in

createdAt.description: The user was created at this time

accountType.description: A user is either an actual User or a Service Account

scimId.description: The SCIM ID of the user, only present if managed by SCIM

activeSessions.description: Count of active browser sessions for this user

deletedSessions.description: Experimental. The number of deleted browser sessions after last login

createUserSchema.description: The payload must contain at least one of the name and email properties, though which one is up to you. For the user to be able to log in to the system, the user must have an email.

username.description: The user's username. Must be provided if email is not provided.

email.description: The user's email address. Must be provided if username is not provided.

name.description: The user's name (not the user's username).

rootRole.description: The role to assign to the user. Can be either the role's ID or its unique name.

sendEmail.description: Whether to send a welcome email with a login link to the user or not. Defaults to `true`.

groupUserModelSchema.description: Details for a single user belonging to a group

joinedAt.description: The date when the user joined the group

createdBy.description: The username of the user who added this user to this group

patSchema.description: Describes a [personal access token](https://docs.getunleash.io/reference/api-tokens-and-client-keys#personal-access-tokens), or PAT. PATs are automatically scoped to the authenticated user.

id.description: The PAT's ID. PAT IDs are incrementing integers. In other words, a more recently created PAT will always have a higher ID than an older one.

secret.description: The token used for authentication. It is automatically generated by Unleash when the PAT is created and that is the only time this property is returned.

createdAt.description: The date and time of when the PAT was created.

seenAt.description: When the PAT was last seen/used to authenticate with. `null` if it has not been used yet.

userId.description: The ID of the user this PAT belongs to.

patsSchema.description: Contains a collection of [personal access tokens](https://docs.getunleash.io/reference/api-tokens-and-client-keys#personal-access-tokens), or PATs. PATs are automatically scoped to the authenticated user.

projectSchema.description: A definition of the project used for projects listing purposes

id.description: The id of this project

name.description: The name of this project

mode.description: The project's [collaboration mode](https://docs.getunleash.io/reference/project-collaboration-mode). Determines whether non-project members can submit change requests or not.

projectsSchema.description: An overview of all the projects in the Unleash instance

version.description: The schema version used to represent the project data.

projects.description: A list of projects in the Unleash instance

roleSchema.description: A role holds permissions to allow Unleash to decide what actions a role holder is allowed to perform

id.description: The role id

type.description: A role can either be a global root role (applies to all projects) or a project role

name.description: The name of the role

description.description: A more detailed description of the role and what use it's intended for
description.example: Users with the editor role have access to most features in Unleash but can not manage users and roles in the global scope. Editors will be added as project owners when creating projects and get superuser rights within the context of these projects. Users with the editor role will also get access to most permissions on the default project by default.

project.description: What project the role belongs to

updateApiTokenSchema.description: An object with fields to updated for a given API token.

expiresAt.description: The new time when this token should expire.

updateUserSchema.description: All fields that can be directly changed for the user

email.description: The user's email address. Must be provided if username is not provided.

name.description: The user's name (not the user's username).

rootRole.description: The role to assign to the user. Can be either the role's ID or its unique name.

id.description: The user id

isAPI.description: Deprecated in v5. Used internally to know which operations the user should be allowed to perform

name.description: Name of the user

username.description: A unique username for the user

imageUrl.description: URL used for the user profile image

inviteLink.description: If the user is actively inviting other users, this is the link that can be shared with other users

loginAttempts.description: How many unsuccessful attempts at logging in has the user made

emailSent.description: Is the welcome email sent to the user or not

seenAt.description: The last time this user logged in

createdAt.description: The user was created at this time

accountType.description: A user is either an actual User or a Service Account

scimId.description: The SCIM ID of the user, only present if managed by SCIM

activeSessions.description: Count of active browser sessions for this user

deletedSessions.description: Experimental. The number of deleted browser sessions after last login

id.description: The identifier for this permission

name.description: The name of this permission

displayName.description: The name to display in listings of permissions

type.description: What level this permission applies to. Either root, project or the name of the environment it applies to

environment.description: Which environment this permission applies to

adminPermissionsSchema.description: What kind of permissions are available

permissions.description: Returns permissions available at all three levels (root|project|environment)

root.description: Permissions available at the root level, i.e. not connected to any specific project or environment

project.description: Permissions available at the project level

environments.description: A list of environments with available permissions per environment

name.description: The name of the environment

version.description: The api version of this response. A natural increasing number. Only increases if format changes

createProjectSchema.description: Data used to create a new [project](https://docs.getunleash.io/reference/projects).

id.description: The project's identifier. If this property is not present or is an empty string, Unleash will generate the project id automatically. This property is deprecated.

name.description: The project's name. The name must contain at least one non-whitespace character.

description.example: This project contains features related to the new pet shop.

mode.description: A mode of the project affecting what actions are possible in this project

defaultStickiness.description: A default stickiness for the project affecting the default stickiness value for variants and Gradual Rollout strategy

environments.description: A list of environments that should be enabled for this project. When provided, the list must contain at least one environment. If this property is missing, Unleash will default to enabling all non-deprecated environments for the project.

changeRequestEnvironments.description: A list of environments that should have change requests enabled. If the list includes environments not in the `environments` list, they will still have change requests enabled.

name.description: The name of the environment to configure change requests for.

requiredApprovals.description: The number of approvals required for a change request to be fully approved and ready to applied in this environment. If no value is provided, it will be set to the default number, which is 1. Values will be clamped to between 1 and 10 inclusive.

createRoleWithPermissionsSchema.description: A write model for the custom role and permissions to allow Unleash to decide what actions a role holder is allowed to perform

name.description: The name of the custom role

description.description: A more detailed description of the custom role and what use it's intended for
description.example: Users with external-contributors role have limited access to most features in Unleash

type.description: [Custom root roles](https://docs.getunleash.io/reference/rbac#custom-root-roles) (type=root-custom) are root roles with a custom set of permissions. [Custom project roles](https://docs.getunleash.io/reference/rbac#custom-project-roles) (type=custom) contain a specific set of permissions for project resources.

permissions.description: A list of permissions assigned to this role

name.description: The name of the permission

environment.description: The environments of the permission if the permission is environment specific

name.description: The name of the custom role

description.description: A more detailed description of the custom role and what use it's intended for
description.example: Users with external-contributors role have limited access to most features in Unleash

type.description: [Custom project roles](https://docs.getunleash.io/reference/rbac#custom-project-roles) contain a specific set of permissions for project resources.

permissions.description: A list of permissions assigned to this role

id.description: The id of the permission

name.description: The name of the permission

environment.description: The environments of the permission if the permission is environment specific

oidcSettingsSchema.description: Settings for configuring OpenID Connect as a login provider for Unleash

enabled.description: Whether to enable or disable OpenID Connect for this instance

clientId.description: The OIDC client ID of this application.

secret.description: Shared secret from OpenID server. Used to authenticate login requests

autoCreate.description: Auto create users based on email addresses from login tokens

enableSingleSignOut.description: Support Single sign out when user clicks logout in Unleash. If `true` user is signed out of all OpenID Connect sessions against the clientId they may have active

defaultRootRole.description: [Default role](https://docs.getunleash.io/reference/rbac#standard-roles) granted to users auto-created from email. Only relevant if autoCreate is `true`

defaultRootRoleId.description: Assign this root role to auto created users. Should be a role ID and takes precedence over `defaultRootRole`.

emailDomains.description: Comma separated list of email domains that are automatically approved for an account in the server. Only relevant if autoCreate is `true`

acrValues.description:
Authentication Context Class Reference, used to request extra values in the acr claim returned from the server. If multiple values are required, they should be space separated. 
 Consult [the OIDC reference](https://openid.net/specs/openid-connect-core-1_0.html#AuthorizationEndpoint) for more information

idTokenSigningAlgorithm.description: The signing algorithm used to sign our token. Refer to the [JWT signatures](https://jwt.io/introduction) documentation for more information.

enableGroupSyncing.description: Should we enable group syncing. Refer to the documentation [Group syncing](https://docs.getunleash.io/how-to/how-to-set-up-group-sso-sync)

groupJsonPath.description: Specifies the path in the OIDC token response to read which groups the user belongs to from.

addGroupsScope.description: When enabled Unleash will also request the 'groups' scope as part of the login request.

enabled.description: Whether to enable or disable OpenID Connect for this instance

clientId.description: The OIDC client ID of this application.

secret.description: Shared secret from OpenID server. Used to authenticate login requests

autoCreate.description: Auto create users based on email addresses from login tokens

enableSingleSignOut.description: Support Single sign out when user clicks logout in Unleash. If `true` user is signed out of all OpenID Connect sessions against the clientId they may have active

defaultRootRole.description: [Default role](https://docs.getunleash.io/reference/rbac#standard-roles) granted to users auto-created from email. Only relevant if autoCreate is `true`

defaultRootRoleId.description: Assign this root role to auto created users. Should be a role ID and takes precedence over `defaultRootRole`.

emailDomains.description: Comma separated list of email domains that are automatically approved for an account in the server. Only relevant if autoCreate is `true`

acrValues.description:
Authentication Context Class Reference, used to request extra values in the acr claim returned from the server. If multiple values are required, they should be space separated. 
 Consult [the OIDC reference](https://openid.net/specs/openid-connect-core-1_0.html#AuthorizationEndpoint) for more information

idTokenSigningAlgorithm.description: The signing algorithm used to sign our token. Refer to the [JWT signatures](https://jwt.io/introduction) documentation for more information.

enableGroupSyncing.description: Should we enable group syncing. Refer to the documentation [Group syncing](https://docs.getunleash.io/how-to/how-to-set-up-group-sso-sync)

groupJsonPath.description: Specifies the path in the OIDC token response to read which groups the user belongs to from.

addGroupsScope.description: When enabled Unleash will also request the 'groups' scope as part of the login request.

passwordAuthSchema.description: Does the server allow username/password authentication

projectAccessConfigurationSchema.description: An object describing roles for a project and what users and groups are part of that role.

roles.description: A list of roles that are available within this project.

id.description: The id of the role.

groups.description: A list of group ids that will be assigned this role

users.description: A list of user ids that will be assigned this role

projectAccessSchema.description: An object describing access permissions for a given project.

groups.description: A list of groups that have access to this project

users.description: A list of users and their roles within this project

roles.description: A list of roles that are available within this project.

projectCreatedSchema.description: Details about the newly created project.

id.description: The project's identifier.

name.description: The project's name.

description.example: This project contains features related to the new pet shop.

featureLimit.description: A limit on the number of features allowed in the project. `null` if no limit.

mode.description: A mode of the project affecting what actions are possible in this project

defaultStickiness.description: A default stickiness for the project affecting the default stickiness value for variants and Gradual Rollout strategy

environments.description: The environments enabled for the project.

changeRequestEnvironments.description: The list of environments that have change requests enabled.

name.description: The name of the environment this change request configuration applies to.

requiredApprovals.description: The number of approvals required for a change request to be fully approved and ready to applied in this environment. If no value is provided, it will be set to the default number, which is 1. The value must be greater than or equal to 1.

roleWithPermissionsSchema.description: A read model for the role and permissions to allow Unleash to decide what actions a role holder is allowed to perform

id.description: The role id

type.description: A role can either be a global `root` role, or a `project` role or a `custom` project role or a custom global `root-custom` role

name.description: The name of the role

description.description: A more detailed description of the role and what use it's intended for
description.example: Users with the editor role have access to most features in Unleash but can not manage users and roles in the global scope. Editors will be added as project owners when creating projects and get superuser rights within the context of these projects. Users with the editor role will also get access to most permissions on the default project by default.

permissions.description: A list of permissions assigned to this role

roleWithVersionSchema.description: A single user role received after creation or update of a role

samlSettingsSchema.description: Settings used to authenticate via SAML

enabled.description: Whether to enable or disable SAML 2.0 for this instance

signOnUrl.description: Which URL to use for Single Sign On

certificate.description: The X509 certificate used to validate requests

signOutUrl.description: Which URL to use for Single Sign Out

spCertificate.description: Signing certificate for sign out requests

autoCreate.description: Should Unleash create users based on the emails coming back in the authentication reply from the SAML server

emailDomains.description: A comma separated list of email domains that Unleash will auto create user accounts for.

defaultRootRole.description: Assign this root role to auto created users

defaultRootRoleId.description: Assign this root role to auto created users. Should be a role ID and takes precedence over `defaultRootRole`.

enableGroupSyncing.description: Should we enable group syncing. Refer to the documentation [Group syncing](https://docs.getunleash.io/how-to/how-to-set-up-group-sso-sync)

groupJsonPath.description: Specifies the path in the SAML token response from which to read the groups the user belongs to.

enabled.description: Whether to enable or disable SAML 2.0 for this instance

signOnUrl.description: Which URL to use for Single Sign On

certificate.description: The X509 certificate used to validate requests

signOutUrl.description: Which URL to use for Single Sign Out

spCertificate.description: Signing certificate for sign out requests

autoCreate.description: Should Unleash create users based on the emails coming back in the authentication reply from the SAML server

emailDomains.description: A comma separated list of email domains that Unleash will auto create user accounts for.

defaultRootRole.description: Assign this root role to auto created users

defaultRootRoleId.description: Assign this root role to auto created users. Should be a role ID and takes precedence over `defaultRootRole`.

enableGroupSyncing.description: Should we enable group syncing. Refer to the documentation [Group syncing](https://docs.getunleash.io/how-to/how-to-set-up-group-sso-sync)

groupJsonPath.description: Specifies the path in the SAML token response from which to read the groups the user belongs to.

name.description: The new name of the project. The name must contain at least one non-whitespace character.

description.description: A new description for the project
description.example: Anything related to the new UI

mode.description: A mode of the project affecting what actions are possible in this project

defaultStickiness.description: A default stickiness for the project affecting the default stickiness value for variants and Gradual Rollout strategy

userWithProjectRoleSchema.description: Data about a user including their project role

isAPI.description: Whether this user is authenticated through Unleash tokens or logged in with a session

name.description: The name of the user

id.description: The user's ID in the Unleash system

imageUrl.description: A URL pointing to the user's image.

addedAt.description: When this user was added to the project

roleId.description: The ID of the role this user has in the given project

roles.description: A list of roles this user has in the given project

groupWithProjectRoleSchema.description: Data about a group including their project role

name.description: The name of the group

id.description: The group's ID in the Unleash system

addedAt.description: When this group was added to the project

roleId.description: The ID of the role this group has in the given project

roles.description: A list of roles this user has in the given project

description.description: A custom description of the group
description.example: Current members of the DX squad

mappingsSSO.description: A list of SSO groups that should map to this Unleash group

rootRole.description: A role id that is used as the root role for all users in this group. This can be either the id of the Viewer, Editor or Admin role.

createdBy.description: A user who created this group

users.description: A list of users belonging to this group

scimId.description: The SCIM ID of the group, only present if managed by SCIM

serviceAccountSchema.description: Represents a [service account](https://docs.getunleash.io/reference/service-accounts). Service accounts are used to let systems interact with the Unleash API.

id.description: The service account id

isAPI.description: Deprecated: for internal use only, should not be exposed through the API

name.description: The name of the service account

email.description: Deprecated: service accounts don't have emails associated with them

inviteLink.description: Deprecated: service accounts cannot be invited via an invitation link

loginAttempts.description: Deprecated: service accounts cannot log in to Unleash

rootRole.description: The root role id associated with the service account

seenAt.description: Deprecated. This property is always `null`. To find out when a service account was last seen, check its `tokens` list and refer to each token's `lastSeen` property instead.

tokens.description: The list of tokens associated with the service account

serviceAccountsSchema.description: Represents a list of service accounts, and includes a list of root roles they reference

rootRoles.description: A list of root roles that are referenced from service account objects in the `serviceAccounts` list

createServiceAccountSchema.description: Describes the properties required to create a new service account

username.description: The username of the service account

name.description: The name of the service account

rootRole.description: The id of the root role for the service account

updateServiceAccountSchema.description: Describes the properties required to update a service account

name.description: The name of the service account

rootRole.description: The id of the root role for the service account

enabled.description: Whether to enable or disable SAML 2.0 for this instance

signOnUrl.description: Which URL to use for Single Sign On

certificate.description: The X509 certificate used to validate requests

signOutUrl.description: Which URL to use for Single Sign Out

spCertificate.description: Signing certificate for sign out requests

autoCreate.description: Should Unleash create users based on the emails coming back in the authentication reply from the SAML server

emailDomains.description: A comma separated list of email domains that Unleash will auto create user accounts for.

defaultRootRole.description: Assign this root role to auto created users

defaultRootRoleId.description: Assign this root role to auto created users. Should be a role ID and takes precedence over `defaultRootRole`.

enableGroupSyncing.description: Should we enable group syncing. Refer to the documentation [Group syncing](https://docs.getunleash.io/how-to/how-to-set-up-group-sso-sync)

groupJsonPath.description: Specifies the path in the SAML token response from which to read the groups the user belongs to.

enabled.description: Whether to enable or disable OpenID Connect for this instance

clientId.description: The OIDC client ID of this application.

secret.description: Shared secret from OpenID server. Used to authenticate login requests

autoCreate.description: Auto create users based on email addresses from login tokens

enableSingleSignOut.description: Support Single sign out when user clicks logout in Unleash. If `true` user is signed out of all OpenID Connect sessions against the clientId they may have active

defaultRootRole.description: [Default role](https://docs.getunleash.io/reference/rbac#standard-roles) granted to users auto-created from email. Only relevant if autoCreate is `true`

defaultRootRoleId.description: Assign this root role to auto created users. Should be a role ID and takes precedence over `defaultRootRole`.

emailDomains.description: Comma separated list of email domains that are automatically approved for an account in the server. Only relevant if autoCreate is `true`

acrValues.description:
Authentication Context Class Reference, used to request extra values in the acr claim returned from the server. If multiple values are required, they should be space separated. 
 Consult [the OIDC reference](https://openid.net/specs/openid-connect-core-1_0.html#AuthorizationEndpoint) for more information

idTokenSigningAlgorithm.description: The signing algorithm used to sign our token. Refer to the [JWT signatures](https://jwt.io/introduction) documentation for more information.

enableGroupSyncing.description: Should we enable group syncing. Refer to the documentation [Group syncing](https://docs.getunleash.io/how-to/how-to-set-up-group-sso-sync)

groupJsonPath.description: Specifies the path in the OIDC token response to read which groups the user belongs to from.

addGroupsScope.description: When enabled Unleash will also request the 'groups' scope as part of the login request.

identifier.description: The ID of the Edge process, typically a ULID. Newly generated for each restart of the instance.

appName.description: The name of the application, configured by the user, typically persistent across restarts of Edge.

region.description: Which region the Edge instance is running in. Set to AWS_REGION by default (if present).

edgeVersion.description: Which version (semver) of Edge is the Edge instance running.

started.description: RFC3339 timestamp for when the Edge instance was started.

connectedStreamingClients.description: How many streaming clients are connected to the Edge instance.

connectedEdges.description: A list of Edge instances connected to the Edge instance.

edgeProcessMetricsSchema.description: Represents Edge instance resource usage data.

cpuUsage.description: CPU usage, in seconds, since start of process.

edgeInstanceTrafficSchema.description: Represents requests to the Edge instance (/api/client/features, /api/frontend, etc.)

accessDenied.description: A map containing requests that were denied.

cachedResponses.description: A map containing requests that had cached responses.

edgeLatencyMetricsSchema.description: Representing latency for an Edge operation.

avg.description: Average time per request in milliseconds.

p99.description: 99% of requests finished within this amount of milliseconds.

edgeUpstreamLatencySchema.description: Latencies for upstream actions from Edge (downloading/syncing new features, uploading metrics, uploading instance data)

apiKey.name: Authorization
apiKey.description: API key needed to access this API

bearerToken.description: API key needed to access this API, in Bearer token format

tags.name: Addons
tags.description: Create, update, and delete [Unleash addons](https://docs.getunleash.io/addons).

tags.name: Admin UI
tags.description: Configuration for the Unleash Admin UI. These endpoints should not be relied upon and can change at any point without prior notice.

tags.name: API tokens
tags.description: Create, update, and delete [Unleash API tokens](https://docs.getunleash.io/reference/api-tokens-and-client-keys).

tags.name: Archive
tags.description: Revive or permanently delete [archived feature flags](https://docs.getunleash.io/advanced/archived_toggles).

tags.name: Auth
tags.description: Manage logins, passwords, etc.

tags.name: Banners
tags.description: Create, update, flag, and delete [banners](https://docs.getunleash.io/reference/banners).

tags.name: Change Requests
tags.description: API for managing [change requests](https://docs.getunleash.io/reference/change-requests).

tags.name: Client
tags.description: Endpoints for [Unleash server-side clients](https://docs.getunleash.io/reference/sdks).

tags.name: Context
tags.description: Create, update, and delete [context fields](https://docs.getunleash.io/reference/unleash-context) that Unleash is aware of.

tags.name: Dependencies
tags.description: Manage feature dependencies.

tags.name: Edge
tags.description: Endpoints related to Unleash on the Edge.

tags.name: Environments
tags.description: Create, update, delete, enable or disable [environments](https://docs.getunleash.io/reference/environments) for this Unleash instance.

tags.name: Events
tags.description: Read events from this Unleash instance.

tags.name: Feature Types
tags.description: Manage [feature flag types](https://docs.getunleash.io/reference/feature-toggles#feature-flag-types).

tags.name: Features
tags.description: Create, update, and delete [feature flags](https://docs.getunleash.io/reference/feature-toggles).

tags.name: Frontend API
tags.description: API for connecting client-side (frontend) applications to Unleash.

tags.name: Import/Export
tags.description: [Import and export](https://docs.getunleash.io/how-to/how-to-environment-import-export) the state of your Unleash instance.

tags.name: Instance Admin
tags.description: Instance admin endpoints used to manage the Unleash instance itself.

tags.name: Maintenance
tags.description: Enable/disable the maintenance mode of Unleash.

tags.name: Metrics
tags.description: Register, read, or delete metrics recorded by Unleash.

tags.name: Notifications
tags.description: API for managing [notifications](https://docs.getunleash.io/reference/notifications).

tags.name: Operational
tags.description: Endpoints related to the operational status of this Unleash instance.

tags.name: Personal access tokens
tags.description: Create, update, and delete [Personal access tokens](https://docs.getunleash.io/reference/api-tokens-and-client-keys#personal-access-tokens).

tags.name: Playground
tags.description: Evaluate an Unleash context against your feature flags.

tags.name: Projects
tags.description: Create, update, and delete [Unleash projects](https://docs.getunleash.io/reference/projects).

tags.name: Public signup tokens
tags.description: Create, update, and delete [Unleash Public Signup tokens](https://docs.getunleash.io/reference/public-signup-tokens).

tags.name: Search
tags.description: Search for features.

tags.name: Segments
tags.description: Create, update, delete, and manage [segments](https://docs.getunleash.io/reference/segments).

tags.name: Service Accounts
tags.description: Endpoints for managing [Service Accounts](https://docs.getunleash.io/reference/service-accounts), which enable programmatic access to the Unleash API.

tags.name: Strategies
tags.description: Create, update, delete, manage [custom strategies](https://docs.getunleash.io/reference/custom-activation-strategies).

tags.name: Tags
tags.description: Create, update, and delete [tags and tag types](https://docs.getunleash.io/reference/feature-toggles#tags).

tags.name: Telemetry
tags.description: API for information about telemetry collection

tags.name: Unstable
tags.description: Experimental endpoints that may change or disappear at any time.

tags.name: Users
tags.description: Manage users and passwords.
